instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3662 WD, magsafe light, fan spin but no chime or image
threads.message:
Hi there,

This board was water damaged. Has been to another shop already. They cleaned the board so cant original areas of corrosion. 
I have orange light on MG. Normal fan spin. No light on caps key or USB mouse. No chime, no image.
I took some measurement but now I am stuck and dont know where to look next. Please advice. Thanks!

PPBUS_G3H - 12.6V

PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS - 12.6V

PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER3V3_ISNS - 12.6V

PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER5V_ISNS - 12.6V

PP3V42_G3H - 3.42V

PP5V_S5 - 5V

PP5V_S4 - 5V

PP5V_S3 - 5V

PP5V_S0 - 5V

PP3V3_S5 - 3.3V

PP3V3_S4 - 3.3V

PP3V3_SUS - 3.3V

PP3V3_S3 - 3.3V

PP3V3_S0 - 3.3V

PPVCC_S0_CPU - 1.8V

PP1V35_S3_MEM - 1.36V

PP1V35_S3RS0_CPUDDR - 1.36V

ALL_SYS_PWRGD - 3.2V

EDP_IG_PANEL_PWR - 0V

threads.title: 820-3662 WD, magsafe light, fan spin but no chime or image
threads.message:
Try known good BIOS, if PLT_RESET_L is high.

Check first all SPI Series Termination resistors and traces; clean J6100 too.

threads.title: 820-3662 WD, magsafe light, fan spin but no chime or image
threads.message:
PLT_RESET_L is 3.35V
cleaned J6100.
Checked all SPI Series Termination resistors and traces.
Replaced U5000. PLT_RESET_L still 3.35V.
When I connect USB mouse I get a blink.

threads.title: 820-3662 WD, magsafe light, fan spin but no chime or image
threads.message:
"Try known good BIOS"
???

Did you pick SMC from same board model?
Why did you change it, before testing BIOS?

threads.title: 820-3662 WD, magsafe light, fan spin but no chime or image
threads.message:
Sorry did not understand you.
BIOS you mean U6100?
That one I need to read with the flasher tool and flash it to another bios chip, right? I can not simply replace it from another board.
CMS I have taken from the same board.
Thanks!

threads.title: 820-3662 WD, magsafe light, fan spin but no chime or image
threads.message: If you don't have Medusa, or other adapter for J6100, then you need to remove and flash U6100 externally.

threads.title: 820-3662 WD, magsafe light, fan spin but no chime or image
threads.message: 295? i need to sleep on it :D

threads.title: 820-3662 WD, magsafe light, fan spin but no chime or image
threads.message: "then you need to remove and flash U6100 externally"
